decks.notes: The main concept of this Aggro deck revolving around Jenara, Asura of War is to create a quick and efficient board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing a wide range of powerful creatures like Avacyn's Pilgrim, Mother of Runes, and Vendilion Clique, as well as versatile spells such as Counterspell, Swords to Plowshares, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. With strong support cards like Birthing Pod, Sylvan Library, and Survival of the Fittest, the deck has the flexibility to adapt to different situations and ensure a steady flow of threats to overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by disrupting your opponent's strategy with a variety of removal spells and hand disruption cards. The commander, Obzedat, Ghost Council, provides a recurring threat that is difficult to deal with. The deck also utilizes various enchantments like Contamination and Leyline of the Void to further hinder your opponent's plans. In addition, there are planeswalkers like Elspeth, Knight-Errant and Sorin Markov to generate additional value and provide alternate win conditions. The deck runs a suite of board wipes like Damnation and Wrath of God to reset the battlefield when needed. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outlast and out control your opponent until you can secure the win.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with mana dorks and land enchantments to cast powerful threats like Craterhoof Behemoth and Primeval Titan. It also utilizes land synergy with cards like Titania, Protector of Argoth and Life from the Loam to generate value from lands entering and leaving the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its fast mana production and large threats, while also disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reclamation Sage. It has a toolbox approach with cards like Birthing Pod and Green Sun's Zenith to find the right answer for any situation, and can quickly close out games with cards like Triumph of the Hordes and Scapeshift.

This deck focuses on utilizing Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of different mana costs to create a fast and efficient aggro strategy. The main goal is to ramp quickly with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Arbor Elf, while also utilizing cards like Chord of Calling and Birthing Pod to search for key creatures like Craterhoof Behemoth and Titania, Protector of Argoth. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Scavenging Ooze to provide flexibility and resilience. With an emphasis on ramp and creature synergy, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with efficient threats and disruptive plays to secure the win in a 1 vs 1 Duel Commander format.

This deck focuses on establishing an aggressive board presence early in the game with a variety of efficient creatures and disruption spells. The key strategy is to consistently apply pressure to the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, and Swords to Plowshares. By utilizing powerful cards like Liliana of the Veil and Winter Orb, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and limit the opponent's options. Additionally, the deck includes a strong mana base with a variety of fetch lands and mana dorks to ensure smooth mana development. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a proactive game plan while disrupting their strategies to secure victory.

This aggressive deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and utilizing powerful creatures and spells to deal damage swiftly to the opponent. With a mix of mana acceleration cards, land destruction spells, and aggressive creatures, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Winter Orb can disrupt the opponent's mana base, while cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Inferno Titan provide powerful threats that can quickly end the game. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control to secure a swift victory in one-on-one combat.

This deck revolves around efficiently tutoring and deploying creatures to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of increasing converted mana cost, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and put pressure on the opponent. With a mix of mana accelerants, creature tutors, and powerful finishers like Craterhoof Behemoth, the deck is designed to consistently put threats on the board and close out games before the opponent has a chance to respond. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive creatures and efficient removal spells helps to control the board and protect the key pieces of the aggro strategy.

The deck is focused on ramping up quickly and efficiently to play powerful creatures and overwhelm the opponent with a high number of threats. The key strategy is to use Yisan, the Wanderer Bard's ability to tutor for creatures of increasing mana cost each turn, ensuring a steady stream of threats on the battlefield. The deck also includes various mana dorks and mana acceleration cards to ramp up quickly and cast powerful creatures ahead of schedule. By leveraging the efficient ramp and tutor abilities of its commander and the support cards in the deck, the goal is to quickly establish a dominant board presence and pressure the opponent with a relentless stream of aggro threats.
